info.title: AWS IoT 1-Click Devices Service
info.description:
Describes all of the AWS IoT 1-Click device-related API operations for the service.
 Also provides sample requests, responses, and errors for the supported web services
 protocols.

servers.description: The AWS IoT 1-Click Devices Service multi-region endpoint
The AWS IoT 1-Click Devices Service multi-region endpoint
The AWS IoT 1-Click Devices Service endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)
The AWS IoT 1-Click Devices Service endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)

put.description:
Adds device(s) to your account (i.e., claim one or more devices) if and only if you
 received a claim code with the device(s).

parameters.name: claimCode
parameters.description: The claim code, starting with "C-", as provided by the device manufacturer.

get.description:
Given a device ID, returns a DescribeDeviceResponse object describing the
 details of the device.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the device.

put.description:
Given a device ID, finalizes the claim request for the associated device.

Claiming a device consists of initiating a claim, then publishing a device event, and finalizing the claim. For a device of type button, a device event can be published by simply clicking the device.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the device.

tags.description: A collection of key/value pairs defining the resource tags. For example, { "tags": {"key1": "value1", "key2": "value2"} }. For more information, see AWS Tagging Strategies.

get.description: Given a device ID, returns the invokable methods associated with the device.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the device.

post.description:
Given a device ID, issues a request to invoke a named device method (with possible
 parameters). See the "Example POST" code snippet below.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the device.

allOf.description: The type of the device, such as "button".
The name of the method applicable to the deviceType.

deviceMethodParameters.description: A JSON encoded string containing the device method request parameters.

put.description:
Given a device ID, initiates a claim request for the associated device.

Claiming a device consists of initiating a claim, then publishing a device event, and finalizing the claim. For a device of type button, a device event can be published by simply clicking the device.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the device.

get.description:
Using a device ID, returns a DeviceEventsResponse object containing an
 array of events for the device.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the device.

parameters.name: fromTimeStamp
parameters.description:
The start date for the device event query, in ISO8061 format. For example,
 2018-03-28T15:45:12.880Z

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
The maximum number of results to return per request. If not set, a default value of
 100 is used.

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: The token to retrieve the next set of results.

parameters.name: toTimeStamp
parameters.description:
The end date for the device event query, in ISO8061 format. For example,
 2018-03-28T15:45:12.880Z

get.description: Lists the 1-Click compatible devices associated with your AWS account.

parameters.name: deviceType
parameters.description: The type of the device, such as "button".

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
The maximum number of results to return per request. If not set, a default value of
 100 is used.

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: The token to retrieve the next set of results.

get.description: Lists the tags associated with the specified resource ARN.

parameters.name: resource-arn
parameters.description: The ARN of the resource.

post.description: Adds or updates the tags associated with the resource ARN. See AWS IoT 1-Click Service Limits for the maximum number of tags allowed per resource.

parameters.name: resource-arn
parameters.description: The ARN of the resource.

tags.description: A collection of key/value pairs defining the resource tags. For example, { "tags": {"key1": "value1", "key2": "value2"} }. For more information, see AWS Tagging Strategies.

put.description: Disassociates a device from your AWS account using its device ID.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the device.

delete.description:
Using tag keys, deletes the tags (key/value pairs) associated with the specified
 resource ARN.

parameters.name: resource-arn
parameters.description: The ARN of the resource.

parameters.name: tagKeys
parameters.description: A collections of tag keys. For example, {"key1","key2"}

put.description:
Using a Boolean value (true or false), this operation
 enables or disables the device given a device ID.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the device.

enabled.description:
If true, the device is enabled. If false, the device is
 disabled.

allOf.description: The claim code provided by the device manufacturer.

The total number of devices associated with the claim code that has been processed in
 the claim request.
Device details.
The device's final claim state.
List of available device APIs.
The device's final claim state.
A JSON encoded string containing the device method response.

An array of zero or more elements describing the event(s) associated with the
 device.
The token to retrieve the next set of results.
A list of devices.
The token to retrieve the next set of results.
A collection of key/value pairs defining the resource tags. For example, { "tags": {"key1": "value1", "key2": "value2"} }. For more information, see AWS Tagging Strategies.
The device's final claim state.
The ARN of the device.

An array of zero or more elements of DeviceAttribute objects providing
 user specified device attributes.
The unique identifier of the device.
A Boolean value indicating whether or not the device is enabled.

A value between 0 and 1 inclusive, representing the fraction of life remaining for the
 device.
The type of the device, such as "button".
The tags currently associated with the AWS IoT 1-Click device.
The user specified attributes associated with the device for an event.
The unique identifier of the device.
The device type, such as "button".

DeviceAttributes.description: DeviceAttributes is a string-to-string map specified by the user.

allOf.description: An object representing the device associated with the event.
A serialized JSON object representing the device-type specific event.
The type of the device, such as "button".
The name of the method applicable to the deviceType.
A collection of key/value pairs defining the resource tags. For example, { "tags": {"key1": "value1", "key2": "value2"} }. For more information, see AWS Tagging Strategies.
The device method to invoke.
A JSON encoded string containing the device method request parameters.
A collection of key/value pairs defining the resource tags. For example, { "tags": {"key1": "value1", "key2": "value2"} }. For more information, see AWS Tagging Strategies.

If true, the device is enabled. If false, the device is
 disabled.
